lead_paragraph: Professor Mintz was often described as the father of food anthropology, after the critical and popular success of his 1985 book, “Sweetness and Power: The Place of Sugar in Modern History.”

headline.main: Sidney Mintz, Father of Food Anthropology, Dies at 93
headline.print_headline: Sidney W. Mintz, 93, Father of Food Anthropology, Dies

abstract: Sidney W Mintz, cultural anthropologist known for Marxian perspective linking slavery, capitalism and imperialism with demand for sugar beginning in 17th-century Britain, dies at age 93.
